report_title: Covid-19 Update: Paint Remover Manufacturing Industry
executive_summary: Paint removers produced by the Paint Remover Manufacturing industry serve to loosen paint and clean the underlying surface so that an object can be repainted.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry revenue expected to increase 5.3% in 2021
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry revenue is expected to increase 5.3% in 2021 alone as the economy begins to recover from the coronavirus pandemic.
Global supply chain issues have caused shortages in many key categories for industry operators, including raw materials and packaging.
Revenue for the Paint Remover Manufacturing industry is expected to decline 1.3% in 2020 amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Revenue expected to increase 0.4% annually to 2026
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Revenue for the Paint Remover Manufacturing industry is expected to increase, rising at an annualized rate of 0.4% to $348.9 million over the five years to 2026.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demand from boat repairs and manufacturing to rise
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Product development and rising demand from boat repairers, downstream manufacturers and the construction sector will likely foster this expansion.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Environmentally friendly products to continue development
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Industry operators will likely continue to develop environmentally friendly products as consumers increasingly move away from chemical paint removers that are linked to negative side effects.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures products that loosen paint from surfaces for downstream markets including boat builders, contractors, do-it-yourself consumers and municipalities. Key products include paint and varnish remover, paint thinner and epoxy remover.

threats: Low Performance Drivers - Per capita disposable income

key_trends: Operators have benefited from an overall increase in home improvements
Exports have traditionally been a strong source of revenue growth
Operators have offered new products due to concerns over products containing dangerous chemicals
Consumers will likely spend more on home improvements, increasing demand for industry products
Industry operators will likely continue to develop environmentally friendly products
Operators experience external competition from DIY paint remover formulas
Concerns about safety environmental influence have driven the introduction of new product lines

market_segmentation.segment_description: Home improvement and do-it-yourself (DIY) professionals use products for a range of activities, including paint removal and furniture restoration.
The boat and automobile restoration markets are an important avenue for sale of industry products.
Industrial companies are important markets for industry operators too, as these companies use industry-relevant products in their salvaging and restoration activities.
International trade plays a vital role in the industry. Exports are expected to account for 60.5% of industry revenue in 2021.

products_and_services.product_description: Removers used for paint and varnish with a significant market share.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Thinners for Lacquers and Other Solvent-Based Paint Products
products_and_services.product_description: Thinners used in various applications to thin solvent-based products.
Removers designed to be environmentally friendly and safe for users.

tier_2_suppliers: Mineral & Phosphate Mining in the US
Oil & Gas Field Services in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Restoration activities create the highest demand for industry-relevant products.
Trends in environmental awareness are expected to affect demand for industry products.

international_trade_points.trade_description: In 2021, exports are expected to account for 60.5% of industry revenue. Major exporting countries include Mexico, Canada, China and South Korea.
Imports are expected to satisfy 37.8% of domestic demand in 2021. Major import sources include Canada, Germany, South Korea and the United Kingdom.

business_locations.location_description: Key business location with significant market share.
A major region for paint remover market activities.
Region known for diverse demand in paint remover products.
An important market for industry products.
Key region with a growing market share.
Emerging market in the paint remover manufacturing sector.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Regulations
regulations_points.regulation_description: OSHA and other federal, state and local environmental, zoning, health and safety agencies administer many regulations.
The EPA proposed an amendment to the Toxic Substances Control Act (TCSA) in January 2017 to prohibit the use of methylene chloride.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The US Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The CPSC protects the public from unreasonable risks associated with consumer products under its jurisdiction, including paint remover.
Industry operators are subject to the Clean Water Act (CWA) of 1977, which regulates direct and indirect discharges of pollutants.
The COVID-19 pandemic introduced new regulations to industries throughout the United States.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry assistance level is low and steady.
The regulation level is heavy and increasing.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators primarily compete on the basis of price and quality of goods supplied to the market.
Operators further compete on product quality, consistency and reliability.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The three top companies are expected to account for less than 40.0% of industry revenue in 2021.
There is only one major player, WM Barr & Company Inc., and it competes with regional and local companies.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The main raw material inputs companies require are organic chemicals, including phenol and methylene chloride.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Paint Remover Manufacturing industry has a low level of capital intensity.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The Paint Remover Manufacturing industry relies on demand from downstream manufacturing industries.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Operators in the Paint Remover Manufacturing industry are not exposed to significant technological disruptions.
Operators in the Paint Remover Manufacturing industry tend to rely on successive batch processing techniques.
In recent years, operators have gradually developed high-performance removers.

FAQs.question: How have imports from low-wage countries like China and Mexico impacted your operations?
FAQs.answer: Imports provide a constant flow of domestic demand in this industry.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Downstream industries typically perform well when per capita income increases.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: Spending on R&D and especially on environmentally friendlier products has increased.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Volatility in input prices has affected purchase prices.

FAQs.question: What steps does your company take to ensure that it is safeguarding proprietary information?
FAQs.answer: Industry production techniques are protected by manufacturing patents.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology in its operations?
FAQs.answer: Technological change has been relatively steady.

FAQs.question: Is your company adequately prepared to adjust to changing environmental standards?
Have you had any regulatory expenses that have significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Environmental regulations will have a negative effect on profitability.

FAQs.question: What challenges does your company face financing its ongoing operations?
FAQs.answer: Large operators have easy financing facilities available.

FAQs.question: How has price volatility of inputs affected profit over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: Profitability has decreased due to volatile costs.
